What I worry about is that there is a learning loss where the children are reluctant to go to school. They prefer to study at home, in the end, they lose the golden time for socialization,” he said
“Covid-19 cases rose to a peak on February 16, 2022, with daily cases of 64,718. https://t.co/UDm0Kr20Sd

The Minister added that cases of the Omicron variant in Indonesia currently reach 99.57%. “Indonesia’s testing capability is higher than other Asian countries but still lower than Malaysia,” said the Minister 

@Suharso_M @Jiwamudaindo

The discussion discussed the topic of the Covid-19 Pandemic Outlook.
In the event, the Minister discussed a number of things. 

The increase in Covid-19 cases had increased since the discovery of the Omicron variant in Indonesia on December 15, 2021
